newsitem.title: UK: NWE oil products mostly firmer.
newsitem.headline: NWE oil products mostly firmer.

text.p: NWE oil products were mostly firmer on Tuesday, traders said.
Gasoline was steady to firmer although physical activity was slack. The closing arb window to the United States has taken some support away, dealers said.
Gas oil prices were firmer, matching gains on benchmark gas oil futures.
Traders said business was still fairly thin with the dollar's strength dampening demand from the key German market for barges and ample Russian 0.2 sulphur supplies keeping cargo buyers relaxed.
Flushing diesel barges were traded a couple of times at August IPE +$4 a tonne fob with Rotterdam liftings commanding a $1 premium.

High sulphur fuel oil barges traded a little softer at $86.25 fob ARA after crude futures fell on Monday and with lack of demand. High sulphur cracked Russian cargoes were offered at a strong two means plus $2.
